column1: Complicated Skin Infection due to Staphyloccus Aureus Bacteria
column9: I had a skin infection. Antibiotics (Keflex and Bactrim) didn't get rid of it after 4 days. One IV full of this med and my white blood count returned to normal withing 24 hours. Thank you. For me, it worked. I hope it works for you.

column1: Complicated Urinary Tract Infection caused by E. Coli
column2: kh288411@aol.com, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I had a rather unusual side effect while taking this medicine.  During the second day, I found that my mouth was unusually dry and I had a strong "sulphur" aftertaste. I drank lots of water, gingerale and iced tea, but the sulphury taste was there constantly.  It lasted about another two days after I finished the ten day course. I thought thi9s was strange, since I was taking the drug by IV twice a day.

column2: uneed2no, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)
column9: My mother-in-law experienced severe reactions to this medication. It caused halucinations, difficulty speaking,(tongue)seizures and weakness.

column2: prayerworks, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month
column9: This medication caused severe complications for my mother-in-law.(administered through IV) She began experiencing halucinations,a type of convulsions, and difficulty speaking. These complications lasted for over a week, and we feared she would never recover from the side effects.

column2: DavidSpe, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have experienced headache, dizziness, nausea, hallucinations, anxiety, feeling as though I am losing consciousness.  These incidents have kept me from driving a car for fear I will cause an accident.  It does seem to have controlled bacterias that were causing my illness.
